description: Borrowed from Latin locatio, locationis (“a placing”), from locare (“to place, put, set, let”), from locus (“a place”). Equivalent to locate +‎ -ion.

entries.meaning: A particular point or place in physical space.

examples: The Ontario tunnel was not located in pursuance of the law relating to tunnel-sites. Lewis failed to follow up his discovery of mineral therein with any effort whatever towards completing the statutory location of a mining claim.

entries.meaning: (South Africa) An apartheid-era urban area populated by non-white people; township.
examples: It is the sounds of apartheid, of the townships, the locations […]

entries.meaning: (law, Scotland) A contract for the use of a thing, or service of a person, for hire.
(law, US) The marking out of the boundaries, or identifying the place or site of, a piece of land, according to the description given in an entry, plan, map, etc
(Kenya) An administrative region in Kenya, below counties and subcounties, and further divided into sublocations.
